Paul Conroy.Action: Screams for help and displays panic when trapped in the coffin.
Attempts to move, uses Zippo lighter to illuminate surroundings despite his bindings and confined space.
Initially panics and screams uncontrollably after realizing he is trapped in a coffin.
Removes the rag muffling his mouth while still holding the lit Zippo, showing presence of mind under extreme stress.
Frantically flails and slams against the coffin walls with no apparent result, indicating a moment of desperation and lack of effective strategy.
Tries desperately to use a rusty nail to cut through the ropes binding his hands, showing persistence despite extreme difficulty.
Attempts to calm himself despite panic and claustrophobia, showing self-control.
Uses a rusty nail to carefully cut through the old, frayed ropes binding his hands despite tight quarters.
Tries to pry off the top of the coffin but quickly realizes it is futile due to reinforcement by sand.
Struggles violently and ineffectively to escape initially, causing sand to trickle in.
After initial panic, manages to calm himself somewhat despite severe stress and physical constraints.
Cries out of despair while trapped, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Tries persistently to reach the phone despite physical exhaustion, showing determination but no clear social warmth in this action.
Attempts to push the coffin lid off with leg strength but fails and becomes exhausted.
Drops his feet from the coffin lid, cries out of frustration and despair.
Notices another broken plank with a small hole near his head but does not immediately act on it.
Extinguishes his lighter to conserve resources and avoid detection in absolute darkness.
Quickly responds to the vibrating old cell phone despite the confined space, and uses both feet and hands skillfully to retrieve it.
Flips open the phone and puts the receiver in front of him promptly, showing readiness to communicate or engage.
Screams for help and repeatedly calls 911 despite being trapped in a coffin, showing desperation and hope for rescue.
Struggles to remember the Safe Number and cannot recall it; unable to find the piece of paper with the number in his wallet, which is missing important contents.
Attempts to call emergency services by dialing 001 and then 911 despite difficult conditions; manages to get a live operator on the phone.
Screams for help inside the coffin but realizes the words barely pass coffin walls, showing some awareness of the situation and reasonable attempt to get help.
Frantically searches pockets for useful items but retrieves irrelevant objects first (prescription bottle, flask) and fails to locate important paper, showing disorganized, panicked behavior.
Keeps trying different methods to get hold of help, including repeatedly attempting to use the Zippo light and calling 911 again after being put on hold.
Pleading sincerely for help despite extreme panic and fear, communicates honestly about his situation to the 911 operator.
Manages to call 911 despite extreme panic and being buried alive, attempts to communicate his situation.
Cannot provide clear information about his location, struggles to stay coherent due to panic.
Begins a call for help and repeatedly tries to communicate his dire situation despite confusion and lack of understanding from the operator.
Shows emotional vulnerability by starting to cry while recounting the attack and loss of colleagues.
Gives up the call after realizing it is futile and the operator cannot assist him, showing resignation and frustration but no hostility.
Leaves urgent, desperate voice messages for his wife and home, pleading for help and trying to communicate his dire situation.
Plea to loved one: 'Please, baby, please call me.'
Attempts to contact the FBI through 411 operator, showing persistence and trust in authorities.
Closes the Zippo lighter to conserve oxygen in a confined space.
Calms himself and controls hyperventilation despite panic.
Uses the cellphone to call 411 to reach the FBI despite limited information and stressful conditions.
Struggles to specify the location of the FBI and shows some confusion/frustration with the 411 operator's questions but adapts by choosing a big city like Chicago.
Carefully writes down the FBI phone number on the coffin despite pen failure, persevering to get the message out.
Calmly explains his situation to the FBI agent, demonstrating trust and openness.
Writes down the full phone number despite pen malfunction by quickly switching to a pencil, then makes a call to the FBI to request help.
Calmly explains the dangerous situation and his current location to the special agent despite being buried and presumably distressed.
Responds urgently and sincerely to Special Agent Harris, pleading for help.
Shows frustration and shouts at Special Agent Harris when not being listened to.
Tries to clarify the situation patiently after calming down.
Dismisses the information request (social security number) as irrelevant given his circumstances.
Despite being trapped and losing contact, persistently tries to get a call through to seek help.
Clearly communicates urgency and emergency to the CRT operator, showing sincerity and trustworthiness.
Leaves a detailed, sincere voicemail begging for help despite confusion and fear.
Explodes with rage and fear, screams and flails wildly when phone signal is lost.
Leaves a detailed and urgent voicemail explaining his situation clearly despite confusion about being connected to HR.
Fails to ensure he is connected to the right person and accepts being placed on hold without questioning further.
Remains persistent in trying to get help despite losing phone signal and increasing desperation.
Becomes exasperated and reacts with rage and panic by screaming and flailing, which might impair problem-solving ability.
Calms down after an outburst, systematically navigates an unfamiliar phone menu in Arabic to find the text message.
Writes down the unusual phone number and attempts to call it despite poor reception.
Repeats dialing and tries to communicate despite initial silence and unclear responses.
Momentarily explodes with rage and fear, causing the phone to close and interrupt progress.
Repeatedly insists he is not a soldier and explains his true role calmly to Jabir.
Expresses desperation and pleads for help, showing vulnerability.
Crosses out the word 'HELP?' and closes the Zippo lighter lid, subtly withdrawing from an emotional plea.
Calmly communicates with Jabir despite confusing and threatening interaction, trying to clarify his identity and situation.
Attempts to deny being a soldier and insists he is just a truck driver, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Crosses out the word 'HELP?' and closes the Zippo lighter, choosing to limit light source and stay cautious.
Displays despair and uncertainty when confronted with Jabir's insistence and threats, indicating moments of psychological vulnerability.
Fails to influence Jabir or change his demands, showing limited leverage or control in the situation.
Offers to have the Embassy pay Jabir if he lets Paul go, trying to negotiate calmly.
Persistently tries to escape from the coffin despite exhaustion.
Carefully uses the Zippo lighter to illuminate the coffin and maximize chances of escape.
Attempts to contact Donna and others despite limited resources, showing persistence and concern.
Shows frustration when calls are not answered, indicating emotional investment in others' well-being.
Tries to recall important phone numbers under stress but initially cannot remember them.
Extinguishes the Zippo flame to conserve his limited oxygen supply, showing awareness of resource management.
Systematically dials the international code and uses 411 information effectively to track down Donna's number.
Decides to choose one of the two listed numbers to call despite uncertainty, demonstrating decisive action under pressure.
Writes down important information (Donna's number and name) on the coffin to keep it accessible.
Expresses frustration at the phone ringing without answer, but persists until Donna finally answers.
Persistently tries to reach Linda during an emergency, asks Donna to help find a number despite Donna's reluctance.
Yells at Donna repeatedly, losing temper and escalating the situation, causing Donna to hang up.
Attempts to urgently get help by asking Donna to look up the State Department number and use star sixty-nine to find Linda's number.
Loses control and becomes aggressive, yelling at Donna repeatedly, which causes her to hang up on him.
Apologizes sincerely to Donna for yelling before asking for help again.
Shows emotional vulnerability by breaking down, crying, and expressing fear of death.
Hangs up on Donna mid-sentence after she provides the number.
Bangs his fists and claws at the coffin in frustration, injuring himself and screaming uncontrollably.
Calms himself after an outburst, slows his breathing, and makes a deliberate and measured phone call to Donna to request the number again.
Writes down the phone number and its significance clearly on the coffin for future reference.
Hangs up on Donna mid-sentence immediately after getting the number, showing control over the interaction.
Attempts to call the State Department to seek help after being buried alive.
Hangs up on Donna mid-sentence.
Expresses frustration and impatience toward State Department representative but remains focused on seeking help.
Immediately dials the State Department and clearly explains his situation.
Provides accurate details about his captivity despite extreme stress.
Lost the safety number given to him and does not have the military contact info.
Hangs up on Donna mid-sentence, showing impatience which might hinder communication.
Attempts to keep the State Department engaged and stresses urgency firmly but clearly.
Sarcastically responds to Rebecca's questions about the ransom.
Expresses frustration and demands help sincerely despite difficult circumstances.
Questions Rebecca firmly about the rescue efforts and shows skepticism about their ability to help.
Uses sarcasm in response to kidnappers' threat, maintaining some psychological composure.
Expresses confusion and frustration when Rebecca knows his name without him giving it, indicating vulnerability.
Expresses intense frustration and desperation but tries to maintain contact with Rebecca, seeking reassurance and connection.
Shows impatience and anger towards Rebecca for not breaking policy, calling out her privileged position.
Writes down important information given by Rebecca carefully, showing trust in her help.
Keeps calm enough to continue communication, takes down important contact information meticulously.
Expresses intense frustration, yells at Rebecca, questions policy angrily without constructive follow-up.
Initially resists Rebecca's advice not to contact the news, showing distrust.
Eventually acquiesces to Rebecca's pleading and refrains from contacting the news, demonstrating some trust and cooperation.
Expresses excitement and relief when reaching Dan Brenner, indicating sincerity and friendliness.
Expresses relief and tears of joy upon hearing rescue efforts are underway, showing sincere emotional response.
Cooperates patiently and attentively during conversation, following instructions while concerned for safety.
Communicates calmly and clearly with Dan, provides honest answers about his situation and phone battery, and follows instructions to conserve battery and try to find clues.
Expresses concern about oxygen use when asked to use the lighter, showing awareness of his environment and potential dangers.
Initially unaware of exact depth underground and uncertain about details, showing some lack of precise knowledge about his own situation.
Expresses desire to do right by his family.
Fears the kidnapper will hang up and hesitates but ultimately follows Dan's instruction to take the call.
Calls Jabir 'son of a bitch' and labels him a terrorist during the call.
Recognizes Jabir's call immediately by matching the number to the one written on the coffin and informs Dan.
Hesitates briefly before taking Jabir's call despite Dan's urging, showing some lack of decisiveness.
Engages in negotiation with Jabir, attempts to negotiate for more time and clarifies government stance on ransom.
Expresses emotion and loses composure by insulting Jabir directly.
Worries that Jabir will hang up before taking the call, showing alertness to situation urgency.
Explains calmly he is just a truck driver who wants to go home and does not make decisions, tries to de-escalate tension.
Refuses to accept blame for the situation, insists he is just there to work and rebuild.
Persists in communicating with Jabir despite hostility, attempts to cooperate by agreeing to make the video for release.
Shows signs of stress and crumbling under pressure.
Asks if he will be let go if ransom is paid, shows hope and trust in negotiation.
Struggles to reach the metal box and carefully examines it with curiosity and caution.
Crumbles up the ransom note in frustration and covers face with hands, showing vulnerability and emotional expression.
Listens to son's outgoing message and smiles with tears, showing tenderness and affection.
Hangs up without leaving a message after hearing son's voice.
Dials Dan Brenner to share critical information about the phone number and cooperate toward rescue.
Finds several useful items including a jackknife and a folded piece of paper; carefully examines them in low light.
Attempts to read the ransom message but gives up after realizing it's unintelligible and crumples it in frustration.
Calls home and listens to the outgoing message from his son but hangs up without leaving a message.
Monitors phone battery level and other status details attentively.
Remembers the calling shortcut and changes phone from vibrate to audible to make a call to Dan Brenner.
Communicates clearly and efficiently with Dan Brenner, providing a critical phone number.
Expresses frustration and anger towards Dan, accusing 'you people' of caring more about politics than rescuing hostages.
Shows vulnerability and a plea for care when asking if Dan cares about him.
Asks about the possibility of tracking his cell signal and understands the challenges involved.
Asserts his willingness to make the ransom video despite advice to hold off, prioritizing his chances of escape.
Expresses frustration and anger, challenging Dan's focus on political containment over personal rescue.
Becomes emotionally overwhelmed, resulting in verbal outbursts and loss of diplomacy toward Dan.
Questions Dan about the kidnappers, shows concern about the situation beyond himself.
Rejects the idea of violence to solve problems ('I wouldn't kill someone').
Suggests straightforward solution to pay the kidnappers to end the crisis.
Pushes Dan to share names of rescued individuals to 'make me know they really do matter to you'.
Gets frustrated by Dan's reluctance but continues engaging in conversation.
Questions Dan persistently about the kidnappers and rescue efforts, pushing for concrete answers.
Expresses frustration and impatience with Dan without offering alternative solutions or strategies.
Challenges assumptions about the kidnappers and their motives, indicating critical thinking.
Responds emotionally and bluntly with 'Fuck you' earlier, showing momentary loss of control.
Shows concern and fear about the condition of a friend (MARK WHITE) and asks carefully about his status.
Expresses anxiety openly and honestly, admitting to needing medication to cope.
Responds with relief and appreciation when reassured that help is coming.
Remembers the name 'Mark White' and circles it on the coffin, showing presence of mind and attention to detail.
Shakes the glow stick to restore its light, maintaining a useful resource.
Expresses desire to get out of the coffin immediately, showing awareness of his situation and goal-oriented mindset.
Checks for anxiety medication and takes pills as advised to conserve oxygen, following instructions carefully.
Feels and admits to nausea and anxiety but continues to try to calm himself.
Asks questions about rescue and situation, indicating proactive information seeking.
Does not try to take unnecessary risks or act impulsively when anxious.
Answers Jabir's call despite the tense situation, tries to comply with demands despite not understanding Arabic.
Expresses inability to make the video as requested due to language barrier, refuses to do it hastily or deceitfully.
Keeps calm under pressure, tries to conserve phone battery to maintain communication.
Attempts to calm himself by taking pills and alcohol to manage panic.
Hesitantly calls Maryanne Conroy at the nursing home.
Tries multiple times to fix the flashlight by twisting and banging it until it works again.
Despite panic and desperation, attempts to calm himself by taking pills and alcohol to steady breathing.
After several attempts to use the limited light and calming methods, he hesitates but still tries to make a phone call for help.
Expresses immediate hopelessness verbally ('I'm never getting out of here.') and shows signs of panic and growing desperation.
Patiently and gently tries to remind his mother who he is despite her confusion with Alzheimer's.
Shows emotional vulnerability, silently crying while maintaining a heartbroken smile.
Expresses concern and care by asking about the living conditions at the nursing home and sending flowers earlier.
Mentions the possibility that this might be the last time he talks to his mother, showing sincerity and emotional depth.
Maintains calm and patient demeanor while talking to his confused mother suffering from Alzheimer's, attempts to remind her of shared memories gently.
Admits honestly to his mother that he is not doing well and that this may be their last conversation, showing emotional honesty but potentially indicating emotional vulnerability.
Tries to stimulate his mother's memory by referencing specific past details (e.g., address, nickname) to reconnect her with her present reality.
Calls his mother to say goodbye and expresses love sincerely.
Cries openly showing emotional vulnerability and sincere grief.
Desperately pleads for the woman’s safety, showing concern and compassion for another’s life.
Pleads for the hostage taker not to shoot the woman because she is a mother with two kids.
Attempts to comply with the hostage taker’s demands to make the video despite obvious stress and fear.
Attempts to reason calmly and delay the captor's demands despite urgent threat.
Struggles to quickly understand the ransom script and reacts with frustration.
Prepares the video message carefully by setting up lighting and positioning himself for clarity on the phone screen.
Sends a sincere and urgent video message pleading for help, expressing hope for the woman's safety by looking at her photo admiringly.
Tries to remain calm and control his breathing despite extreme anxiety and fear in a life-threatening situation.
Carefully and cautiously investigates a disturbing sensation in the coffin without panic or rashness.
Carefully inspects feet with glow stick before realizing there is a snake near him, showing caution and patience.
Acts decisively to protect himself by using fire to fend off a dangerous snake without unnecessary cruelty, demonstrating practical and measured behavior.
Handles the snake situation quickly and calmly, uses his shirt and lighter to block the hole.
Pours alcohol over shirt but leaves flask cap loose and places lighter unsafely.
Desperately tries to reach the lighter to prevent fire despite physical limitations.
Shows frustration and panic but perseveres in his efforts to avoid disaster.
Hastily stuffs the hole where the snake entered with his shirt and pours alcohol over it to presumably deter the snake or secure the blockage.
Does not screw the flask cap on securely after putting it down, leading to accidental spillage later.
Successfully handles the snake situation initially and lets out a sigh of relief, showing some composure under pressure.
Frenzied and unsuccessful attempts to retrieve his ringing phone from a small hole using his feet, showing frustration and limited effectiveness.
Painstakingly turns his body inside a confined space to face the other end, demonstrating persistence and physical effort under difficult constraints.
Accidentally kicks the Zippo lighter from its place and knocks over the flask, leading to a dangerous situation of spilled alcohol threatening to ignite.
Panics and desperately tries to reach the Zippo to prevent a fire but is physically stuck and unable to act further.
Deftly maneuvers to prevent the alcohol trail from igniting the flame, avoiding potential disaster.
Stuffs cloth into a hole in the coffin to maintain safety, showing care and precaution.
Hesitates to return a missed call from Jabir, instead exploring the phone for a solution.
Dials his wife's phone, leaves a loving and urgent message asking her to call him immediately.
Finds and changes the phone language setting to English, navigates menus quickly, and records the cell phone number clearly on the coffin.
Dials his wife’s phone and leaves an urgent voicemail including instructions and the phone number, demonstrating presence of mind under stress.
Checks battery life and time, calmly assessing his situation and risks.
Attempts to use the pocket knife to pry the coffin open, showing resourcefulness but is limited by the available tools.
Tries to use a glow stick that breaks and leaks, then a flashlight that fails after a brief moment, reacting with frustration but continuing attempts at illumination.
Tries repeatedly to free himself using a knife despite difficulty and physical strain.
Hesitates but watches a disturbing video message of a hostage execution, showing emotional reaction and concern.
Switches flashlight bulbs to find one that works and attempts to use a knife as a fulcrum despite difficulty.
Pushes his physical limits by trying to bend the knife blade beyond design in a desperate escape attempt.
Stops to catch his breath when oxygen is critically low, showing self-awareness of physical limits.
Shows trepidation and fear before watching the ransom video, indicating emotional vulnerability but situational awareness.
Expresses overwhelming grief and despair after witnessing Pamela's death, including vomiting and attempting to harm himself but ultimately refraining.
Calmly and deliberately contacts Brenner despite extreme emotional distress, indicating presence of mind and a measure of trustworthy composure.
Attempts to cut his jugular vein but ultimately decides not to proceed with suicide, showing restraint despite extreme mental and physical distress.
After initial emotional breakdown and vomiting, gradually regains composure and is able to use the flashlight and seek out a phone number written on the coffin.
Makes a calm, detached phone call to Brenner despite the extreme trauma and pressure he is experiencing.
His initial reaction includes screaming, slamming his fist, and vomiting, indicating emotional overwhelm and possible lack of immediate capacity to respond effectively.
Expresses deep distrust and cynicism toward those trying to help him, suggesting they look the other way and don't care about him or others.
Calmly discusses details with Dan and shares information he discovered, demonstrating cooperation and sincerity despite extreme circumstances.
Remains surprisingly calm and detached under extreme stress.
Figures out how to change the display language on the phone to find out the phone number, while others including Dan did not.
Expresses distrust and cynicism that could undermine cooperation with his rescuer.
Challenges Dan's reassurances and competence during a critical situation.
Pauses before answering about the convoy attack, showing emotional struggle; describes the chaotic situation with concern for comrades.
Expresses disbelief and distress over witnessing his friends getting killed, showing empathy and emotional sensitivity.
Switches communication channels after knowing that CB radios had been compromised.
Stops abruptly when confronted with a crowd of kids, possibly exposing convoy to danger.
Fails to respond immediately to Dan's questioning about what happened.
Provides a detailed, coherent explanation of the ambush and sequence of events.
Observes attack and killings but only watches without acting to defend or escape immediately.
Uses physical strength and ingenuity to prevent the coffin top from collapsing and reduce sand infiltration, despite extreme exhaustion and danger.
Answers the cell phone immediately with urgency and tries to communicate his situation clearly.
Attempts repeatedly to get a signal and keep the flashlight on to maintain some hope or contact.
Focuses on his dire situation without showing signs of blaming others or exhibiting anger.
Assesses the situation carefully, moving away slowly from the crack to avoid further collapse.
Shakes the flashlight and cell phone in attempts to make them work.
Answers the ringing cell phone immediately and tries to communicate clearly with the contact on the other end.
Exhibits signs of panic and disbelief but maintains efforts to find solutions.
Expresses frustration and anger towards Alan's concern with damage control instead of immediate help.
Pleading for help urgently and sincerely to Alan.
Manages to restore the flashlight by hitting it a few times, demonstrating quick problem-solving under pressure.
Refuses to engage with the media to keep the situation contained, showing awareness of crisis management protocols.
Expresses frustration with Alan's focus on damage control instead of immediate rescue, showing emotional distress but also a realistic grasp of his dire situation.
Asks for help directly and urgently in a moment of extreme danger, showing survival instinct but limited options for strategic action.
Responds with frustration and confusion to formal, impersonal questioning, showing impatience but remains cooperative by answering questions.
Responds promptly to questions despite confusion and stressful situation (e.g., answering 'Yes' when asked for permission to record)
Attempts to operate the flashlight by hitting it, successfully turning it back on after it initially goes out
Shows frustration and dismissiveness towards the questioning (e.g., saying 'Who cares? This is fucking crazy'), indicating difficulty managing stress effectively
Admits to signing contract and answers questions honestly despite frustrating situation.
Clarifies that his relationship with Pamela Gorham was just friendship when accused.
Responds with frustration and anger to being questioned and terminated.
Confronts Alan Davenport about the unfair denial of insurance money and expresses anger at being abandoned.
Refuses to answer Alan's questions calmly, instead telling him to 'go to hell' and calling him a 'bastard'.
Repeatedly tries to call Jabir despite no answer, showing concern and persistence.
Expresses desperation and exhaustion verbally, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Mentally contemplates Jabir’s fate and the implications of the bombing, showing empathy and worry for others.
Relays bad news calmly and directly to Dan Brenner, indicating a serious and sincere demeanor.
Acknowledges Dan's efforts and appreciates them despite hopelessness.
Expresses resignation and shares vulnerable thoughts in a last will and testament video for his wife and son.
Silently accepts Dan's lie and does not confront him about it.
Forces a smile to his lachrymose face, showing an attempt at kindness or maintaining connection despite despair.
Acknowledges the hopelessness of his situation realistically without delusion.
Questions whether his captors' death would nullify chances of rescue, showing practical thinking.
Recognizes the limits of others' knowledge and accepts uncertainty calmly.
Asks what he should do despite no real options, showing readiness to seek guidance.
Ends call with Dan after hope fades, showing acceptance of reality.
Creates a last will and testament video, indicating foresight and presence of mind under dire circumstances.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and regret over lack of achievements and belongings.
Makes a heartfelt video message to his son, expressing love, regret, advice, and asking for promises to care for family and do the right thing.
Apologizes to Linda for not listening.
Carefully places the phone into his pocket hoping it may be found, showing foresight and presence of mind.
Responds immediately to the incoming call from Jabir, indicating alertness and quick reaction.
Struggles to provide useful information when asked about the money, showing lack of knowledge or control over the situation.
Insists he is telling the truth and refuses to cut off his thumb despite intense pressure.
Pleads for more time and for release, showing desperation but also sincerity.
Responds respectfully to Jabir by calling him 'Sir' out of respect.
Expresses deep concern and longing to return home to his wife and son, showing emotional sincerity.
Calls his wife frantically to warn her and their son to leave the house for safety.
Dismissively calls his captors 'peasants, criminals', indicating contempt and lack of tolerance.
Denies the captors' knowledge as a way to belittle them, showing hostility and distrust.
Responds quickly and urgently by calling his wife's cell phone after Jabir’s threat to warn them to leave the house immediately.
Expresses disbelief and insults Jabir’s threats, dismissing their knowledge and capabilities.
Keeps composure enough to communicate respectfully ('Yes, sir') despite the tense situation.
Urgently warns about kidnapper knowing personal address and urges contact with Sheriff's station to stay safe.
Expresses frantic concern for others' safety, including delivering a desperate voicemail to Dan Brenner.
Mentally struggles with fear and doubts but remains focused on protecting family despite pain and stress.
Sacrifices his thumb by amputating it to meet demands and protect his family.
Manages his intense pain and fear to fulfill a promise to Jabir, showing commitment and sincerity.
Fights with every last ounce of strength to remain conscious despite extreme physical distress.
Ekes out a tortured smile when light hits him, showing a fragile but sincere response to hope/rescue.
Too exhausted to display disappointment or concern over his situation or the phone stopping its vibration.
Barely able to respond verbally to a call from Brenner, indicating diminished interaction but still makes an effort to communicate.
Expresses hope and gratitude to Dan, saying 'Okay. I believe you. Thank you. Thank you.'
Calls Linda despite the desperate situation, showing concern and connection to loved ones.
Reassures Linda repeatedly that everything will be okay despite his dire situation.
Expresses sincere love and emotional vulnerability to Linda, admitting fault and apologizing.
Keeps calm and comforting toward Linda while she is hysterical.
Shakes the flashlight to regain strength and repeatedly hits it to keep it working despite flickering.
Calms Linda with reassuring statements, displaying emotional control and confident communication despite dire circumstances.
Admits to Linda that he should have listened and regrets his decision to come here.
Reassures Linda with repeated promises to come home and expresses love sincerely.
Urgently communicates with Dan Brenner and urges him to hurry, showing trust and reliance on rescuers.
Keeps calm under extreme pressure and effectively communicates urgent need for rescue, repeatedly urging Dan and soldiers to hurry.
Maintains presence of mind to manage multiple phone calls and switch between lines quickly.
Does not panic despite deteriorating conditions (sand rising, flashlight dimming), continues to focus on survival and coordination with rescuers.
Spits away falling sand to avoid suffocation, repeatedly urges rescuers to hurry and tries to communicate despite difficult conditions.
Unable to hear rescuers clearly and becomes increasingly desperate and panicked, culminating in repeated pleas and frustration.
Maintains awareness of his surroundings and what is happening above ground, attempts to stay conscious and interactive despite life-threatening situation.
